title: Chapter 1 Quiz: Introduction to Humanoid Robotics
description: Test your understanding of humanoid robot fundamentals, history, and applications.

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic that distinguishes humanoid robots from other robot types?
options: B. They are designed to resemble and mimic the human body
C. They can only work in factories
questions.explanation: Humanoid robots are specifically designed to resemble the human body in form and function, with features like a head, torso, two arms, and two legs. This distinguishes them from industrial or specialized robots.

questions.question: Approximately how many degrees of freedom (DOF) does the human body have?
questions.explanation: The human body has approximately 244 degrees of freedom. Modern humanoid robots typically implement between 20-50 DOF to achieve functional human-like movement.

questions.question: Karel Čapek coined the term 'robot' in his 1920 play R.U.R.
questions.explanation: Karel Čapek introduced the term 'robot' in his 1920 play R.U.R. (Rossum's Universal Robots), deriving it from the Czech word 'robota' meaning forced labor.

questions.question: Which company developed ASIMO, one of the most famous humanoid robots?
questions.explanation: Honda developed ASIMO (Advanced Step in Innovative Mobility), which was unveiled in 2000 and became one of the most recognized humanoid robots for its advanced bipedal locomotion.

questions.question: Name three key characteristics of humanoid robots.
questions.correct_answer: Key characteristics include: bipedal locomotion, anthropomorphic design, dexterous manipulation, sensory perception, and social interaction capability.
questions.explanation: Humanoid robots share defining characteristics such as walking on two legs (bipedal locomotion), human-like body proportions (anthropomorphic design), ability to grasp objects (dexterous manipulation), multiple sensing capabilities, and the ability to interact with humans.
